channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: It's like 'dead birds flying': How bird flu is spreading in the wild
item.description: That's the way one scientist puts it — referring to how infected wild birds survive long enough to spread it to birds and mammals around the world. And that's a serious risk for human health.
item.content:encoded:
That's the way one scientist puts it — referring to how infected wild birds survive long enough to spread it to birds and mammals around the world. And that's a serious risk for human health.

(Image credit: Ralph Venstreets/University of California, Davis)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Disney, GM and others scrub DEI language, NPR finds. And, unusual virus trends
item.description: Several large U.S. companies deleted some or all DEI references from their most recent annual reports to investors, an NPR analysis finds. And, unusual trends are driving winter respiratory viruses.
item.content:encoded:
Several large U.S. companies deleted some or all DEI references from their most recent annual reports to investors, an NPR analysis finds. And, unusual trends are driving winter respiratory viruses.

(Image credit: Arturo Holmes)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: U.S. education policy is at a crossroads. This congressional hearing shows why
item.description: The House education committee is charged with forging consensus on the nation's education policy. But at a recent meeting, partisan differences were on full display.
item.content:encoded:
The House education committee is charged with forging consensus on the nation's education policy. But at a recent meeting, partisan differences were on full display.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana/AP; Getty Images; Photo collage/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Do you remember 'Sharpiegate'? What about Roman numerals? Find out in the quiz
item.description: This week calls for some throwback thinking. If you can recall how Roman numerals work, you'll get at least one question correct.
item.content:encoded: This week calls for some throwback thinking. If you can recall how Roman numerals work, you'll get at least one question correct.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: What does Trump mean when he invokes America's 'Manifest Destiny'?
item.description: The 19th century term describes the perceived right of Americans to use force or the threat of force to wrest desireable land from the grasp of others.
item.content:encoded:
The 19th century term describes the perceived right of Americans to use force or the threat of force to wrest desireable land from the grasp of others.

(Image credit: Charlie Riedel)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Health care is key for youths getting out of prison. A new law helps them get it
item.description: It's common for young people leaving jails and prisons to end up back behind bars, often after lapses related to untreated mental illness or substance abuse. A new law will help them get Medicaid.
item.content:encoded:
It's common for young people leaving jails and prisons to end up back behind bars, often after lapses related to untreated mental illness or substance abuse. A new law will help them get Medicaid.

(Image credit: Oona Zenda)
item.dc:creator: Renuka Rayasam

item.title: Trump's executive actions curbing transgender rights focus on 'gender ideology'
item.description: President Trump signed a series of executive actions that would limit transgender and nonbinary people's rights by focusing on "gender ideology." But the term is loaded, without a universal definition.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump signed a series of executive actions that would limit transgender and nonbinary people's rights by focusing on "gender ideology." But the term is loaded, without a universal definition.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Republicans race to release plans to advance Trump policy agenda in Congress
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson is working with House Republicans to advance a budget bill that would allow Republicans to pass many of Trump's top policy priorities without threat of a Senate filibuster.
item.content:encoded:
House Speaker Mike Johnson is working with House Republicans to advance a budget bill that would allow Republicans to pass many of Trump's top policy priorities without threat of a Senate filibuster.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Japan's Ishiba to push importance of alliance during visit with Trump
item.description: Trump has long felt that Japan and other wealthy allies take advantage of the U.S., racking up big trade surpluses, while paying too little for the cost of American military protection.
item.content:encoded:
Trump has long felt that Japan and other wealthy allies take advantage of the U.S., racking up big trade surpluses, while paying too little for the cost of American military protection.

(Image credit: Kevin Wolf)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Here's a Super Bowl riddle: Why are egg prices surging — but not chicken wings?
item.description: There is one economic riddle ahead of Super Bowl Sunday: The egg market has been hit hard by avian flu, but wings are abundant and relatively affordable this year. So what gives?
item.content:encoded:
There is one economic riddle ahead of Super Bowl Sunday: The egg market has been hit hard by avian flu, but wings are abundant and relatively affordable this year. So what gives?

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley
